text.content: Spectre: The AR Platform Empowering Critical Facilities Maintenance

Transform your maintenance workflows with augmented reality technology. Spectre gives technicians superpowers through hands-free digital twin integration, real-time task execution, and seamless data management on Microsoft HoloLens 2.

Convert facility data from spreadsheets, CAD drawings, and building models into interactive 3D environments. All facility information converges into one spatially-aware platform accessible through mixed reality.
Automatic data conversion from existing systems
Execute maintenance tickets through dedicated AR interfaces. Access task descriptions, attached documents, and step-by-step checklists directly at equipment locations with hands-free navigation.
Access inventory catalogs and order parts directly through the AR interface. Real-time inventory visibility eliminates delays and ensures technicians have required components when needed.
Transform documentation workflows by linking physical actions to digital records. Access historical maintenance data and capture new documentation seamlessly within the AR environment.
Hands-free snapshot capture with air tap
Snapshot Feature: Press the snapshot button, look at the desired capture area, and perform an air tap. Pictures appear in the documentation list within 2-3 seconds.
Access main menu by looking at left hand
Pin/unpin windows to follow or stay fixed
Toggle object visibility by system type
Designed for technicians who need both hands free for maintenance work. All interactions use voice commands, eye tracking, and gesture controls optimized for field environments.
Proven Success: Tyndall Air Force Base Case Study
Spectre was initially developed as a prototype for Tyndall Air Force Base to streamline complex maintenance procedures for defense facilities. The implementation successfully demonstrated:
Challenge: Complex utilities and temperature control systems required frequent maintenance with multiple documentation requirements and coordination between planning office and field execution.
Solution: Spectre provided technicians with maintenance spots windows directly in the field, access to historical photos, and seamless task switching capabilities.
Hands-free access to all task information

Ready to revolutionize your facilities maintenance with augmented reality? Spectre delivers measurable improvements in efficiency, accuracy, and cost reduction while ensuring your critical systems remain operational.
Schedule a demonstration to see Spectre in action at your facility. Experience firsthand how augmented reality transforms maintenance workflows.
Contact our team for a customized assessment of your facility needs and implementation timeline. Get started with a pilot program today.
Developed by Spiral - Leading the future of industrial augmented reality solutions.
Modernizing borescope inspections with AI-powered reporting for aircraft engine maintenance.
Hero Product Interface Mockup - Clean dashboard showing AI analysis results with highlighted defects and AMM reference citations in sidebar
Transform tedious 60-minute manual inspections into precise 5-minute automated reports with full CFM56 AMM compliance. BAR eliminates inspection inconsistencies while reducing AOG exposure.
Before/After Process Comparison - Side-by-side visual showing traditional manual documentation vs BAR automated workflow with time stamps
Subjective: Inconsistent defect classification between inspectors
Costly delays: $25,000+ per aircraft per day AOG penalties
AI-powered image analysis with automated defect detection
Automated AMM reference validation and compliance checking
Structured PDF reports with audit trails ready in minutes
Consistent findings across all inspection teams
Process Flow Diagram - Four-step visual workflow from image upload through AI analysis to report generation and MRO integration
Upload borescope images of hot section blades, compressor vanes, or combustion liners. System supports standard inspection formats and multi-angle captures.
AI engine detects chord-wise cracks, erosion, corrosion, burn spots, and FOD. Every detection cross-checked against CFM56 AMM Feb 2021 reference thresholds.
Structured reports include finding type, AMM reference codes, severity levels, and recommended actions. Export-ready PDFs with traceable audit metadata.
Instant delivery via PDF downloads, MRO platform sync with AMOS, Ramco, and Trax, or API integration into airline maintenance ecosystems.
Product Interface Screenshot - BAR analysis view showing borescope image with red overlay highlighting trailing edge crack detection
Analysis Panel Detail - Right sidebar displaying AMM reference 72-00-00 Fig. 5 with serviceable recommendation for 250-cycle extension
Defect Types Matrix - Visual grid showing different anomaly categories with example images and detection accuracy rates
Chord-wise and span-wise crack identification with precise measurement capabilities
Erosion patterns at leading and trailing edges plus comprehensive corrosion assessment
Burn spots, thermal discoloration, and foreign object damage detection with severity classification
Benefits Overview Chart - Visual grid showing safety, efficiency, consistency, and cost advantages with supporting metrics
Every finding linked to authoritative OEM-approved manuals, reducing risk of undocumented or misclassified defects.
BAR ensures 10 different inspectors produce identical report structure for the same defect across all locations.
API integration connects BAR seamlessly to your existing digital maintenance pipeline, not as standalone software.
Average inspection time drops from 45 minutes to 5 minutes, dramatically reducing AOG exposure and maintenance costs.
AES-256 encryption at upload with ISO/IEC 27001 and GDPR compliant processing for complete data protection.
Customer Testimonial Card - European airline case study with company logo and key performance metrics in clean layout
We cut borescope inspection analysis time in half. What once took nearly an hour now takes under 5 minutes, and our engineers get consistent AMM references every time.
Performance Metrics Infographic - Clean visual showing inspection volume growth, time savings, and cost reduction data
$120,000+ AOG cost savings in first quarter alone
Industry Sectors Grid - Professional icons representing airlines, MRO providers, and licensed inspection services
Reduce aircraft downtime, standardize maintenance procedures across entire fleets, and eliminate hidden AOG costs.
Scale inspection capacity without workforce expansion. Ensure consistent quality standards across multiple service locations.
Focus on critical decision-making rather than report documentation. BAR handles paperwork while preserving professional judgment authority.
Pricing Tiers Table - Clean three-column comparison showing Starter, Pro, and Enterprise plans with feature highlights
All pricing plans include 14-day free trial period plus 30-day money-back guarantee for risk-free evaluation.
Call-to-Action Button - Start Your Free Trial Today with prominent styling and contact information
Interactive ROI Tool - Calculator interface showing potential savings based on fleet size and current inspection frequency
Save 40+ engineering hours monthly through consistent inspection documentation and reduced manual reporting work.
Standardize hundreds of inspections across multiple client accounts with unified reporting and quality standards.
Up to $25,000 daily savings per aircraft through faster inspection turnaround and reduced ground time exposure.
System Architecture Diagram - Clean visual showing BAR connections to major MRO platforms and airline maintenance systems
Direct integration with AMOS, Ramco Aviation, and Trax maintenance management systems
RESTful API with webhook support for seamless data flow into existing airline digital maintenance ecosystems
PDF downloads with audit metadata, structured data formats, and customizable report templates for compliance
Evolution Timeline - Visual progression from manual paper-based inspections to AI-powered digital compliance systems
BAR represents the evolution of aircraft maintenance from reactive to predictive. It empowers inspectors with AI assistance while maintaining human oversight and professional accountability.
In aviation where regulatory traceability is paramount, BAR functions as your digital assistant that maintains perfect AMM reference accuracy and comprehensive inspection documentation.
